ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a strong understanding of influential philosophy from Descartes to Beauvoir. I am now better able to read and understand philosophy and know many more concepts.
A greater understanding of philosophy and ability to write philosophical papers.
How to write a philosophy paper
I learned how to write philosophy. This was one of the first philosophy classes I have taken, and I did not know how to reconstruct arguments before. This was an incredibly useful skill to learn.
I learned how to analyse philosophical arguments and really pick them apart step by step.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved everything about this course, especially the section discussions since our class and Professor dynamic produced vibrant discussions. Since the workload is already quite heavy, perhaps the syllabus can be altered so we can dive deeper into particular works.

Weaknesses- Philosophical terms should have been introduced more gradually instead of just in lecture (this is not Professors fault, more of a program issue) 

Strengths- the professor was very engaged and is an incredible philosopher who looks at various philosophical issues with a modern lens
Amazing professor, flexible office hours, could use slightly more directed discussions at times

Strength: interesting readings, helpful lectures, wonderful faculty
Weakness: sometimes readings were too long, repetitive, and occasionally irrelevant - what we weren't able to cover in class felt pointless.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend this course to another student because although it is difficult it is very rewarding and well structured for learning.
Yes definitely - I loved the syllabus for this semester!
Yes! Philosophy is not my strong suit but its wonderful to gain this foundation!
Yes, sadly Manon is no longer teaching at Yale but she is amazing and the course material is as well
I would recommend the course. Much of Spring DS is hard and very metaphysical, but it is a rewarding class and worth the challenge.
Yes. Directed Studies was a great program.
YES! I learned so much in DS Philosophy and reading Kant completely transformed the way I view morality -- many parts of this course make you consider your own life!
